messages.content:
The best way to update Node.js depends on how you installed it. Here are the most common methods:

### Using a Node Version Manager (nvm)

This is the recommended method for developers as it allows you to manage multiple versions of Node.js on your system.

1.  **Install nvm** (if you don't have it):
    ```bash
    curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.3/install.sh | bash
    ```
    You may need to restart your terminal after installation.

2.  **Install the latest version of Node.js**:
    ```bash
    nvm install node
    ```

3.  **Switch to the new version**:
    ```bash
    nvm use node
    ```

### Using the Official Installer

If you're not managing multiple versions, you can download the latest installer from the [official Node.js website](https://nodejs.org/). Running the installer will update your current version.

### Using Homebrew (macOS)

If you installed Node.js with Homebrew:

1.  **Update Homebrew**:
    ```bash
    brew update
    ```

2.  **Upgrade Node.js**:
    ```bash
    brew upgrade node
    ```

After updating, you can verify the new version by running `node -v` in your terminal.
